definitions.example: The Venus of Willendorf was an early representation of the female body.
We are no longer happy with your representation of our company at trade events.

definitions.definition: The lawyers and staff who argue on behalf of another in court.
definitions.example: People who cannot afford representation are eligible for government assistance.

definitions.definition: The ability to elect a representative to speak on one's behalf in government; the role of this representative in government.
definitions.example: The lack of representation in the British parliament was one of the main factors behind the American Revolution.

definitions.definition: An object that describes an abstract group in terms of linear transformations of vector spaces; (more formally) a homomorphism from a group on a vector space to the general linear group (group of all bijective linear transformations) on the space.
A figure, image or idea that substitutes reality.
